job.title: Staff Site Reliability Engineer, Factory Software Systems
job.description: RoleThe Ignition Support team at Tesla manages our Ignition deployment, and infrastructure. As an SRE on the Ignition Support team you'll be responsible for automating the deployment, configuration, management, and monitoring of Ignition, as well as troubleshooting issues with the Ignition application and assisting us with upgrading to version 8.1.ResponsibilitiesSupport our Ignition deployment and infrastructure in every way possible to ensure its reliability, availability, and securityAssist Software, Controls, Manufacturing, and other engineering teams with onboarding to IgnitionAutomate deployment, configuration, management and monitoring of IgnitionEnsure best practices and observability of the Ignition, such as metrics, logging, tracing, and alertingConsult on and design infrastructure, systems and application architecturesHelp develop automation for Ignition 8.1RequirementsExperience with Virtualization (vSphere)Expert skills in Linux and its administration (Ubuntu 16.04/18.04/20.04)Understanding of networking (Routing/Switching, VLANs, Firewalls, and Load Balancers)Experience in a high-level language such as Go, Python and/or JavaObservability (InfluxDB, Kapacitor, Prometheus, AlertManager, Grafana, and/or Splunk)Infrastructure as Code (Terraform/Ansible)CI/CD pipeline experience (GitHub Enterprise)Artifact management (Artifactory)Bare-metal imaging experience (Ubuntu netboot PXE)Strong bias for action vs endless planning, willing to get hands dirty and make mistakes sometimes3+ years as DevOps/Site Reliability EngineerHabitual documenter and spreader of knowledgeWilling to mentor other team members and engineers with less SRE/IT type knowledgeComfortable on an on-call rotationComfortable doing live troubleshooting of issues on NOC bridges/outage calls
